comments:
Error when launching Eclipse with no configuration directory.

When starting the Eclipse 3.1 M6 driver (Stream Stable Build Fri, 1 Apr 2005 -- 
16:45) with the configuration directory deleted, the below error is generated:

!SESSION 2005-04-11 08:44:27.533 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM Windows 32 build cn142-20040926 (JIT enabled: 
jitc)
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-04-11 08:44:27.533
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.RuntimeException: No application id has been found.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run
(PlatformActivator.java:206)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:344)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:156)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:85)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:58)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:391)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:315)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:268)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:942)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:926)

Created an attachment (id=19740)
Contents of the generated configuration directory.

Yup.  the config.ini is no longer optional.  Dare I ask what scenario makes it 
critical that you be able to delete the config dir?

The use case for this defect is backing-out an existing configuration to the 
default (e.g. out-of-the-box) confirmation.

In the future, we will use the -clean option or removing the inner folders and 
leaving the config.ini intact.
Thanks Pascal for the resource link.

traces.message: No application id has been found.
